sen.j: 桂宮（かつらのみや）は、宮家の一つで、四世襲親王家の一つ。
sen.e: Katsuranomiya is one of the Miyake (princely house) and also one of the four heredity Imperial prince' family.
Katsuranomiya is one of the Miyake (prince's palaces) and also one of the four heredity Imperial prince' families.
Katsuranomiya is one of the Miyake (houses of an imperial princes) and also one of the four heredity Imperial prince' families.
sen.cmt: 表現変更"families allowed to have the status of Imperial family"→"houses of an imperial princes"に変更しました。

sen.j: 桃山時代に創設され、明治時代に断絶した。
sen.e: It was established in the Momoyama period and the family discontinued in the Meiji period.
It was established in the Momoyama period and the family was discontinued in the Meiji period.
It was established in the Momoyama period and the family was discontinued in the Meiji period.

sen.j: 主な所領地が、平安京近郊の桂にあった。
sen.e: The main private land of Katsuranomiya located in Katsura, near Heiankyo. (Heian Palace)
The main private land of Katsuranomiya located in Katsura, near Heiankyo. (Heian Palace)
The main private land of Katsuranomiya located in Katsura, near Heiankyo (Heian Palace).

sen.j: 昭和時代に同名の宮家が創設された。
sen.e: There was a Miyake with the same established in Showa period.
There was the same Miyake established in Showa era.
There was the same Miyake established in Showa period.
sen.cmt: era→period ファイル内で統一

sen.j: 桂宮家は、正親町天皇の第一皇子である誠仁親王の第六皇子・智仁親王を祖とする。
sen.e: Katsuranomiya family's ancestor was the Imperial Prince Sanehito's (Emperor Ogimachi's first Prince) sixth Prince of Imperial Prince Toshihito.
The ancestor of the Katsuranomiya family was the Imperial Prince Sanehito's (Emperor Ogimachi's first Prince) sixth Prince of Imperial Prince Toshihito.
The ancestor of the Katsuranomiya family was the Imperial Prince Sanehito's (Emperor Ogimachi's first Prince) sixth Prince of Imperial Prince Toshihito.

sen.j: 智仁親王は初め豊臣秀吉の猶子となったが、秀吉に実子が生まれたため、豊臣家を離れ、あらたに秀吉から知行地を献じられることとなり、一家を立てた。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Toshihito was adopted by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, but after Hideyoshi had his own son, the Prince left Toyotomi family and was given the estate by Hideyoshi, and he established his own family.

Imperial Prince Toshihito was adopted by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, but after Hideyoshi had his own son, the Prince left the Toyotomi family and was given an estate by Hideyoshi, and he established his own family.

Imperial Prince Toshihito was adopted by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, but after Hideyoshi had his biological son, the Prince left the Toyotomi family and was given an estate by Hideyoshi, and he established his own family.

sen.j: 智仁親王が作った別邸が有名な桂離宮である。
sen.e: The name of another palace Imperial Prince Toshihito buit was the famous Katsura Imperial Villa.
The name of another palace that Imperial Prince Toshihito built, was the famous Imperial Katsura Villa.
sen.cmt: punctuation, spelling, word order, revised for clarity
sen.e: The name of another palace that Imperial Prince Toshihito built, was the famous Imperial Katsura Villa.

sen.j: その別邸である桂離宮が京都八条通の沿線上にあったことから八条宮と称された。
sen.e: That villa, Katsura Imperial Villa was called Hachijonomiya, since it was located on the railroad line of Kyoto Hachijo Street.
That villa, Imperial Katsura Villa was called Hachijonomiya, since it was located on the railroad line in Kyoto on Hachijo Street.
That villa, Imperial Katsura Villa was called Hachijonomiya, since it was located on the Hachijo Street in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: スペースrailroad line in Kyoto on削除 昔から八条宮と呼ばれており、その当時は鉄道はなかったので、沿線は鉄道ではなく単に八条通のこと。

sen.j: 5代の八条宮尚仁親王に継嗣がなく、霊元天皇の皇子である作宮が継承して常磐井宮に改称したが夭折し、兄の京極宮文仁親王が跡を継いで京極宮に改称した。
sen.e: Since the fifth Hachijonomiya Imperial Prince Naohito had no successor, Emperor Reigen's son, Sakunomiya succeeded the family and renamed Tokiwainomiya, however the family discontinued, his older brother Kyogokunomiya Imperial Prince Ayahito succeeded and renamed Kyogokunomiya.

Since the fifth Hachijonomiya Imperial Prince Naohito had no successor, Emperor Reigen's son, Sakunomiya succeeded the family and was renamed Tokiwainomiya, however the family was discontinued, and then his older brother Kyogokunomiya Imperial Prince Ayahito succeeded and was renamed Kyogokunomiya.

Since the fifth Hachijonomiya Imperial Prince Naohito had no successor, Emperor Reigen's son, Sakunomiya succeeded the family and was renamed Tokiwainomiya, however he died young, and then his older brother Kyogokunomiya Imperial Prince Ayahito succeeded and was renamed Kyogokunomiya.
sen.cmt: the family was discontinued→he died young

sen.j: 9代・京極宮公仁親王の歿後、一旦空主となるが、光格天皇の皇子・桂宮盛仁親王が継承して桂宮に改称した。
sen.e: After the ninth Kyogokunomiya Imperial Prince Kinhito died, there was no one to succeed the family for a while, after that, Emperor Kokaku's Prince, Katsuranomiya Imperial Prince Takehito succeeded and renamed Katsuranomiya.

After the ninth Kyogokunomiya Imperial Prince Kinhito died, there was no one to succeed the family for a while, so, Emperor Kokaku's Prince, Katsuranomiya Imperial Prince Takehito succeeded and was renamed Katsuranomiya.

After the ninth Kyogokunomiya Imperial Prince Kinhito died, there was no one to succeed the family for a while, so, Emperor Kokaku's Prince, Katsuranomiya Imperial Prince Takehito succeeded and was renamed Katsuranomiya.

sen.j: 桂宮盛仁親王の歿後再び空主となった。
sen.e: After Katsuranomiya Imperial Prince Misahito died, again there was no one to succeed to the family for a while.
After Katsuranomiya Imperial Prince Misahito died, again there was no one to succeed the family for a while.
After Katsuranomiya Imperial Prince Takehito died, again there was no one to succeed the family for a while.

sen.j: 桂宮盛仁親王の兄である仁孝天皇の皇子・桂宮節仁親王が継ぐが夭折して空主となる。
sen.e: After Katsuranomiya Imperial Prince Takehito's older brother, Emperor Ninko's Prince, Katsuranomiya Imperial Prince Misahito succeeded the family but the family discontinued and there was no one existed as the head of the family.

After Katsuranomiya Imperial Prince Takehito's older brother, Emperor Ninko's Prince, Katsuranomiya Imperial Prince Misahito succeeded the family, but the family discontinued, and then there was no one at the head of the family.

After Katsuranomiya Imperial Prince Takehito's older brother, Emperor Ninko's Prince, Katsuranomiya Imperial Prince Misahito succeeded the family, but he died young, and then there was no one at the head of the family.

sen.j: 1862年（文久2年）に姉の桂宮淑子内親王が継ぎ、1881年（明治14年）に歿して桂宮は断絶した。
sen.e: In 1862 older sister, Katsuranomiya Imperial Princess Sumiko succeeded to the family, but after she died in 1881, Katsuranomiya discontinued.
In 1862 older sister, Katsuranomiya Imperial Princess Sumiko succeeded to the family, but after she died in 1881, Katsuranomiya discontinued.
In 1862 older sister, Katsuranomiya Imperial Princess Sumiko succeeded to the family, but after she died in 1881, Katsuranomiya discontinued.

sen.j: 京都御苑内にあった御殿は、そのほとんどが、当時、皇室の離宮であった二条城に移築され、二条城が徳川家の城から皇室の城へと変ったことの、シンボルとして利用された。
sen.e: The most of the Palaces within the Kyoto Imperial Garden were moved to Nijo Castle where Imperial family's villa use to be in those days, the Nijo Castle was used as the symbol of the Tokugawa family castle being changed to the castle of the Imperial family.

Most of the Palaces within the Kyoto Imperial Garden were moved to Nijo Castle where Imperial family's villa was in those days, Nijo Castle was used as a symbol of the Tokugawa family castle being changed to the castle of the Imperial family.

Most of the Palaces within the Kyoto Imperial Garden were moved to Nijo-jo Castle where Imperial family's villa was in those days, Nijo-jo Castle was used as a symbol of the Tokugawa family castle being changed to the castle of the Imperial family.

sen.j: 1988年（昭和63年）、三笠宮三笠宮崇仁親王の第2皇子である桂宮宜仁親王が新宮家を創設し、同名の桂宮を称した。
sen.e: In 1988 Mikasanomiya Imperial Prince Takahito's second son, Katsuranomiya Imperial Prince Yoshihito established new Miyake and gave the same name as Katsuranomiya.
In 1988 Mikasanomiya Imperial Prince Takahito's second son, Katsuranomiya Imperial Prince Yoshihito established new Miyake and gave him the same name Katsuranomiya.
In 1988 Mikasanomiya Imperial Prince Takahito's second son, Katsuranomiya Imperial Prince Yoshihito established new Miyake and gave him the same name Katsuranomiya.

sen.j: これは、宜仁親王の印にちなむものであり、かつてあった桂宮との直接の関係はない。
sen.e: There is no direct relationship with Katsuranomiya, it is related to the symbol of Imperial Prince Yoshihito.
There is no direct relationship with Katsuranomiya, but is related to the symbol of Imperial Prince Yoshihito.
There is no direct relationship with Katsuranomiya, but is related to the symbol of Imperial Prince Yoshihito.
